text: You should use a POST request

text:
```headers = {'X-Application': appKey, 'X-Authentication': sessionToken, 'content-type': 'application/json'}
payload = '{"jsonrpc": "2.0", "id": 1}'

r = <http://requests.post|requests.post>('<https://cashout-service.betfair.com/cashout-service/transactional/v1.0/cashout?_ak=>' + str(appKey)
                  + '&alt=json&currencyCode=EUR&marketId=' + str(market_id) + '&quotePercentage=100&quoteValue=' +
                  str(min_return), data=payload, headers=headers)```

text: Hey everyone, just a quick one this time. I was wondering if it was possible to check games on the exchange for event_id, selection_id, ko time/date etc without certain betfair account details. Ive seen in a few of the examples in the lightweight repository that some operations dont require valid usernames, passwords, appKeys or sessionTokens to be entered (specifically examplestreaminghistorical.py and exampleracecard.py). Is it possible using betfairlightweight to alter the scripts I have already written to retrieve the above mentioned game details such that I no longer have to enter any credentials? Any help is greatly appreciated.

text:
Big <https://forum.developer.betfair.com/filedata/fetch?id=32354|changes> in transaction charges 

```Transaction Charge Changes
Over the years, the Exchange has processed an increasing number of transactions at an ever-increasing cost to infrastructure and stability.
Therefore, from 1st September 2020, Betfair will be changing the thresholds of the Transaction Charge. The changes are as follows:
• The new limit of “free” transactions will be set at 5,000 transactions per hour. o A “transaction” shall include all bets placed and all failed transactions.
• Every transaction that exceeds the limit will incur a cost of £0.002 (a fifth of a penny). o This cost will be offset by a user’s commission generated.
• There will be no exemptions from this charge.
We have modelled the new charge to disincentivise wasteful transactional behaviour and promote platform stability on a level playing field. It is possible to trade multiple events and markets without ever incurring any of these charges.
Your account manager will be in touch if you would have incurred these charges in the past, giving you an opportunity to update trading strategies and fix bugs before the charge goes live on 1st September.```

elements.text: Big
changes
in transaction charges

Transaction Charge Changes
Over the years, the Exchange has processed an increasing number of transactions at an ever-increasing cost to infrastructure and stability.
Therefore, from 1st September 2020, Betfair will be changing the thresholds of the Transaction Charge. The changes are as follows:
• The new limit of “free” transactions will be set at 5,000 transactions per hour. o A “transaction” shall include all bets placed and all failed transactions.
• Every transaction that exceeds the limit will incur a cost of £0.002 (a fifth of a penny). o This cost will be offset by a user’s commission generated.
• There will be no exemptions from this charge.
We have modelled the new charge to disincentivise wasteful transactional behaviour and promote platform stability on a level playing field. It is possible to trade multiple events and markets without ever incurring any of these charges.
Your account manager will be in touch if you would have incurred these charges in the past, giving you an opportunity to update trading strategies and fix bugs before the charge goes live on 1st September.

text: <@U016HAA3E68> has joined the channel

Yeah, offset against commission generated, PC doesn’t count. So again it incentivises outright positions (higher comm generated, lower PC) rather than closing positions (lower comm generated and higher PC charge). 

Note that comm generated any time of that day can be put towards excess transactions in any hour in that day. In other words excess transactions are calculated per hour, but payment / offsetting calculated at the end of day. 

I previously though comm could only offset transactions in the same hour which would have been a nightmare. Since it’s not, the overall charge actually quite reasonable. Generate more comm if you want more transactions.

elements.text: Yeah, offset against commission generated, PC doesn’t count. So again it incentivises outright positions (higher comm generated, lower PC) rather than closing positions (lower comm generated and higher PC charge).

Note that comm generated any time of that day can be put towards excess transactions in any hour in that day. In other words excess transactions are calculated per hour, but payment / offsetting calculated at the end of day.

I previously though comm could only offset transactions in the same hour which would have been a nightmare. Since it’s not, the overall charge actually quite reasonable. Generate more comm if you want more transactions.

text: This is a good change and will benefit genuine traders. Those trying to manipulate the markets by placing and cancelling 1000,s of bets may suffer.

elements.text: This is a good change and will benefit genuine traders. Those trying to manipulate the markets by placing and cancelling 1000,s of bets may suffer.
